Build ID:  M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Installed the JSE java script plugin 
2.And surprisingly When tried to  edit the JSP page got the error org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
3.Plz help me out here.

What is this "JSE java script plugin"? Is it part of Web Tools?
(In reply to comment #1)
> What is this "JSE java script plugin"? Is it part of Web Tools?
> 
> That was one of the plugin used to develope the JSPs that i added in to the plugins folder of the eclipse root folder.
(In reply to comment #2)
> That was one of the plugin used to develope the JSPs that i added in to the plugins folder of the eclipse root folder.

Where did you get that plugin from?
This bug should be directed to the providers of that plugin. This bug is currently assigned to AJDT, the AspectJ Development Tools, which doesn't seem to be the correct project for this problem.



(In reply to comment #3)
true.But may i know what could be the possible reasons for the so that i can dig myself more onto that. 


> (In reply to comment #2)
> > That was one of the plugin used to develope the JSPs that i added in to the plugins folder of the eclipse root folder.
> 
> Where did you get that plugin from?
> This bug should be directed to the providers of that plugin. This bug is
> currently assigned to AJDT, the AspectJ Development Tools, which doesn't seem
> to be the correct project for this problem.
> 

Maybe it's a threading issue - according to the help, under Platform Plug-in Developer Guide > Standard Widget Toolkit > Threading issues:
  "SWT triggers an SWTException for all API calls made from a non-UI thread"
Also you could try looking around the SWT website: http://www.eclipse.org/swt/ or in one of the newsgroups.

I'm closing this bug, as this has nothing to do with AJDT.
